Material used.Material Name: SN dopaminergic neurons from PINK1 knockout mice
Material used.Description: Immunoprecipitation and analysis using confocal microscopy

Readout description.Result Description: No significant fluorescence signal observed in the mitochondria.

Biological replicates.Description: Two biological replicates were performed for each sample.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times to ensure reproducibility.

Basic positive control.Basic positive control: No applicable control in this assay.

Basic negative control.Basic negative control: No applicable control in this assay.

Experiment Method.Statistical analysis method: Non-parametric tests (Mann-Whitney U test) were used to analyze the data.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fluorescence intensity greater than 50% of control baseline.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Fluorescence intensity less than 20% of control baseline.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes, this method is approved for studying PINK1-related Parkinson's disease.

Material used.Material Name: cultured SN dopaminergic neurons from PINK1 knockout mice
Material used.Description: Measurements of membrane potential and action potentials using rotating Nile red dye.

Readout description.Result Description: Rotating Nile red dye fluorescence increased significantly in the mitochondria.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were conducted per treatment group.

Technical replicates.Description: Each measurement was repeated three times to ensure consistency.

Basic positive control.Basic positive control: No applicable control in this assay.

Basic negative control.Basic negative control: No applicable control in this assay.

Experiment Method.Statistical analysis method: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used to compare the fluorescence intensities across different conditions.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fluorescence intensity less than 20% of control baseline.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Fluorescence intensity greater than 80% of control baseline.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes, this method is approved for studying PINK1-related Parkinson's disease.

Material used.Description: Mitochondrial proteins were extracted and analyzed using Western blot.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Defective mitochondrial electron transport chain function
Readout description.Result Description: Reduced expression of Complex I and Complex II subunits.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each protein analysis.

Technical replicates.Description: Each blot was performed twice to ensure reproducibility.

Basic positive control.Basic positive control: Protein A/G beads control used as a positive control.
Basic positive control.Description: Ensured proper loading of antibodies and absence of non-specific binding.

Basic negative control.Basic negative control: Non-specific IgG antibody control used as a negative control.
Basic negative control.Description: Assessed for specificity in antibody binding.

Experiment Method.Statistical analysis method: Mean Â± standard deviation of three independent experiments was calculated.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression levels greater than 10% of control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression levels less than 5% of control.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes, this method is approved for studying PINK1-related Parkinson's disease.

Material used.Material Source: Mitochondrial extract from cultured neurons or purified mitochondria
Material used.Description: Exposure of mitochondrial extracts to the mitochondrial toxin rotenone.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Impaired mitochondrial function leading to increased ROS levels.
Readout description.Result Description: Increased fluorescence intensity in the presence of rotenone.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each treatment condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times to ensure consistency and reproducibility.

Basic positive control.Basic positive control: No applicable control in this assay.

Basic negative control.Basic negative control: No applicable control in this assay.

Experiment Method.Statistical analysis method: Data were analyzed using a two-way ANOVA followed by post-hoc tests.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fluorescence intensity less than 25% of control baseline.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Fluorescence intensity greater than 60% of control baseline.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes, this method is approved for studying PINK1-related Parkinson's disease.
